title: Crazy kid goes on feeding rampage
body:
After his ADC champ got banned (Shaco, yup), this guy went Soraka and was quite toxic and just kept, and still keeps, since the game is still on-going, running it down mid. The game just started and he is 0/9 already.

What do? Why do people like this exist?

EDIT: Riot deleted some of my replies to the original feeder, I guess I can re-post them without the harsh language if anyone interested...

replies.body: Just played this game, I accidentally banned his champion. I didnt think to check our ADC to see if he was playing shaco, and i guess i suffered the consequence of that. He started the game by running down mid and feeding our enemy Twisted Fate. He then went on to spew out toxic chat, and just be a terrible player. I honestly never thought i'd encounter someone so toxic, but boy was I wrong. Literally the cancer of League, its a shame people like him exist. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

"I didn't think"

The guy was toxic but it's your full responsibility for not paying attention to your team and banning their champion...
idgaf if my top laner playing jayce and hes last pick, im banning jayce

You're setting yourself up for failure and are already violating Summoner's Code if you knowingly ban someone's champ that is on your team. 

If that makes them tilt, you deserve the loss.
My point exactly, even though feeding is an ass hat way of going about things.

Just a bit of advice take it as you will.

I understand tilting because your champ got banned, but something that is more fun and won't get you banned is to go ahead and act like everything is fine and select another champ.

Now don't talk in chat (so chat logs can't be used against you) at all when you get in-game and ping MIA when necessary (shows you are communicating with team somewhat), however, when it comes to team fighting you can act like you are going to engage and then walk away as your teammates go into a 4v5. It's a much better way to tilt and doesn't get you banned as it's very hard to prove, just some advice. I suggest not doing this but I understand the frustration that comes from troll bans and that retaliating by feeding can get you banned so there is a better way.
Wow, you are encouraging someone to feed, and how to do it. You actually are on the feeder's side. I cannot believe people like you actually exist.

I'm not encouraging them to feed, just telling them how to troll properly. Hell with my suggestion they could be 0/0/0 the entire game and have a lot of cs. Whether they want to feed with that strat is up to them, the strat I suggested usually gets a you a few kills and assists but once your team gets to late game and fighting a 4v5 is insanely difficult that's where the throw comes in. 

Feeding isn't mentioned at all, don't get worked up m8. Plus with the strat I suggested their teammates have a fighting chance vs. someone that is just "running it down mid" and feeding.

Refusing to cooperate with the team, and AFK farming etc is still a punishable offense "m8."

I suggest reading up on the Summoner's Code, I can link you up if you want.

The thing is there is no way to prove if someone isn't cooperating if their excuse is "that team fight went south before I could do anything."

This is stuff you can learn if you've ever been a part of the Tribunal (if you played back then when the system was active). If you push your lane the entire game and claim you were trying to split-push, you can't get banned.
This is where I would love Riot to come in and ban you just for attempting to give people the advice you just did. Don't need people like you in league.
We don't need people who "don't give a fuck" and ban intent champ picks on purpose, then complaining that they lose the game or the player whose champ got banned tilt to oblivion.
If I get what you are saying here you are saying we don't need either this guy or the guy who bans his champ, which I fully agree. Never said banning the champ someone has set is appropriate.
I bet you'll feel just fine if they banned your intended champ just because "they didn't feel you would play it well"
No, I wouldn't like it, but guess what? I am not 13 years old. I move on and play with one of my many other champs I am quite good at.
Well people react differently. Don't expect everyone to act like you do.
I'd rather play with this guy than a bronze tryhard that bans intent picks, or an overly positive summoners code weirdo.
I mean, I'd rather play with neither.

> Refusing to cooperate with the team

So the one who banned his champ should get a punishement too. Since everyone is part of the team and not only guys who you want to choose. So since the guy banning his champion refused to cooperate with the team (this already starts at checking your allies champs) he should also get a punishement. And the feeder of course too but I only wanted to state that he wasn´t the only one who had an incorrect behaviour.

> [{quoted}](name=MrFluffyPuffy,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ME6Zjji6,comment-id=0003000000000001000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-11-24T15:59:30.343+0000)
>
> So the one who banned his champ should get a punishement too. 

Banning someones champ is not punishable. Riot has stated this. And I'm glad for it cause 1) accidents happen. 2) it can be a smart ban so the enemy doesn't get that champ and 3) cause if its severely off meta in a ranked game you can attempt to avoid the loss and if the person chooses to troll after they will get punished for doing so.
If it's done knowingly and chat logs show that, it's a bannable offense.

> [{quoted}](name=Mr Urgod,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ME6Zjji6,comment-id=0003000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-24T07:20:39.662+0000)
>
> Wow, you are encouraging someone to feed, and how to do it. You actually are on the feeder's side. I cannot believe people like you actually exist.

if your own team bans your champ, you deserve to lose for being a POS scum bag.
And you wonder why you can't climb the ladder. You are a troll by default. Nothing less.
We exist because people like to ban the one champ we want to play, however you look at it, someone else trigger a response that you didnt like but what ever.
Look at this guys, the feeder himself comments, and even tries to justify his actions
Justified? no. but if you are gonna take the option to play the champ that i want to play away from me, i will make sure you cant win, since that is the only way of getting even over the internet

YES I AM! I dont care about thses "teammates" because lets face it, fuck people on the internet. If i were trying to make friends, I would be at park or a party or somewhere social. I want to play a character in a video game and if taking that opportunity away for shits and giggles isnt trolling then feeding shouldnt be considered either. On another note though, if the option to ban a champion that a teammate "intends" to play were taking out, then we would have alot less cases like this wouldnt we. (just a thought)

Well he sure trolled me out of a chance to play the one champ i logged in to play. Maybe next time try talking someone out of a pick before you outright ban it because you will get less "running down mid" usually. And BTW, you cant comment on my pick, then ban it, and then claim "you never saw i inteded to pick it". Thats pretty troll to me
Stop using the word troll, it was NOT a troll. YOU were the troll.

Whatever, He ruined my fun so in return i ruined his. The other three teammates were simply caught in the crossfire which is unfortunate but hey, thats league in a nutshell. (one person's choices can fuck over an entire team)

Since this was a casual game I understand the out of meta pick. That is what unranked is for. However your team even though it is unranked can still decide to not want a champion on their team or in the game at all. Judging by the other comment on this post he did not even mean to ban your champion it was a complete accident and he did not expect you to want to play shaco. Even if it was an intentional ban to stop you from playing shaco adc that does not give you the right to troll an entire game. The fact that through your comments you show no remorse for your actions and worse are trying to justify them by claiming two wrongs make a right, getting even matters, and my favorite statement that people on the internet don't matter and you are not trying to make friends shows that you have some kind of deeper rooted issues as an adult or you are a child that can not handle something so minuscule maturely. You may only be level 19 with 4 other accounts (probably a lie so I am assuming this is his only account) but you need to learn that this is not how you deal with something like this. Grow up.
please tell me you guys were going at it in allchat too, holy shit this is priceless.

Yup, the whole bronze package, even got them to hate the person whom got fed. "report tf for being a skumbag and killing the troll". While granted this all happened in a pre-30's norms. And as for him "not" knowing that i wanted shaco, champs selected by teammates are slightly grey and have no red border unlike all other champs while banning, so its pretty obvious when someone wants something

youd be surprised, its farily easy to ban someones intended pick.  portraits are coloured fully when banning with borders.  if you have a ban in your mind already you will sometimes just go type in the name and ban it. 

no need to troll just to be a butt.

If you are inconsiderate of some one else preferred choice of whom they want to play, but still expect them to be completely acceptable with it being banned is a little hypocritical isn't it. My feelings weren't considered so in return I simply gave no fucks about the feelings of anyone else.
i like potato chips

So your answer to that is to troll EVERYONE then?

How in the hell does that justify your actions?  He trolled you, and you decided to throw a temper tantrum on everyone as a result.  It is fine to be upset when someone does something like that, what isn't fine is taking it out on everyone else.  If something gets you _that_ angry that you want to intentionally troll everyone as a result of it, then just dodge and step away from the game.  Take a break, calm yourself before playing again, and THEN come back to the game.

The dude already explained his position.  He said it wasn't right but if you mess with him you're gonna get it.

So don't mess with people, simple.
Finally someone who has read, because apparently saying that my actions weren't justified but acts of revenge is somehow justifying my actions.

Have you my dear sir thought about how you would feel if someone did this to you and just ran it down mid? imagine how piss a your toxic ass would be, now take that in to account when you be an mega ass

My very next game, shaco was banned by our adc, whom wanted sivir. She picked before me and banned before me so safe to say no sivir was played that game. She then went fiora and ran down bot,which didnt affect me because i was soaking up xp under tower and wasting for 20 mins to come. People do it all the time, where do you think its picked up from?

Meh, just go look at his past posts. This must be an only child because he's obviously never learned compromise, and how to deal with not getting his way. Every post is about himself, and every post is him talking about screwing his teammates over. Man, you need to go do some soul searching. At a certain point your RL friends will get sick of this attitude (there's no way you don't act like this in person, and you can't convince me otherwise) and you'll find yourself without many friends left. Trust me, the older you get, the less cute that attitude is to your friends. I doubt you'll listen to this though, and will instead fire off some selfish excuse to try to justify yourself. Don't waste your time because I won't buy it. Seriously, look into yourself, then become the person you want to see when you do so. If the person you currently are is the person you want to be then, honestly, you're in for a long, rough, lonely life. Fix yourself.

Alright man, logic doesn't get through to you so I'm gonna be blatant and then I'm walking away because as a real adult I don't waste my time in cyclical conversations. The strong majority of what you say is wrong. Flat out, straight up, plain and simple wrong. You make direct claims of understanding that what you did was wrong, but you still say that you'll do it anyways. That means that yes, you are trying to justify it. You just don't have the gumption to stand beside your own words. Let me explain what that means, that means that you only claim to understand it like you do in order to save face. You want to look good up front so that when what's on the inside comes out you can say, "no no no, I said the other thing". Here's something that will get you far in life, when people talk, never listen to the words they speak, only listen to what they're truly saying between the lines. People can lie and obfuscate all they want, but ultimately you will always say what you're really thinking even when you don't realize you do it. You are a very selfish person, there's no way around that. However, it can be changed simply by being honest with yourself. I will not enable you by responding to you over and over so that you can drill your own justifications into your own head, which is what you're doing right now. I sincerely wish you the very best. I truly do, but as for me, I have far more important things to do than to try to enlighten someone who wishes to remain in darkness, making your name extremely ironic. Have a good day/night/whatever it is where you are when you see this.
You're the kind of person who doesn't listen, but instead waits for his turn to talk aren't you?

And they are entitled to ban whoever they like. You may request that they do not ban a specific champion, but you cannot demand it.
It's ultimately up to the ones who is banning to decide who to ban. Something you should be prepared for the moment you queue up.

If the champion you primarily wanted to play is banned for whatever reason(!), you suck it up, put the team before yourself and play some other champion.
They are ntitled to the ban and can ban whoever they please, but when you ban someones champ and they tilt, dont act surprised.

You don't "tilt" over a ban in champion select. You might have been tilted entering champion select, or chat may tilt you, but over a ban? Nope, that's just you being an immature child, looking to get angry at anything.

No, i don't like the fact that someone can take the opportunity for me to enjoy myself while playing a game i fairly enjoy most of the time, so when it does happen i do get childish and try to get even, I wont "turn the other cheek" but instead will try to get the last laugh.
